The introduction to Reactive Programming you've been missing
Raw
introrx.md

The introduction to Reactive Programming you've been missing你一直错过的反应式编程介绍

(by @andrestaltz)(作者：@andrestaltz)

This tutorial as a series of videos本教程是一系列的视频

If you prefer to watch video tutorials with live-coding, then check out this series I recorded with the same contents as in this article: Egghead.io - Introduction to Reactive Programming.如果你喜欢看现场编码的视频教程，那么请看我录制的这个系列，内容与本文相同。Egghead.io - 反应式编程介绍。

So you're curious in learning this new thing called Reactive Programming, particularly its variant comprising of Rx, Bacon.js, RAC, and others.所以你很想学习这个叫做反应式编程的新东西，特别是它的变体，包括Rx、Bacon.js、RAC和其他。

Learning it is hard, even harder by the lack of good material. When I started, I tried looking for tutorials. I found only a handful of practical guides, but they just scratched the surface and never tackled the challenge of building the whole architecture around it. Library documentations often don't help when you're trying to understand some function. I mean, honestly, look at this:学习响应式编程是很困难的一个过程，特别是在缺乏优秀资料的前提下。刚开始学习时，我试过去找一些教程，并找到了为数不多的实用教程，但是它们都流于表面，从没有围绕响应式编程构建起一个完整的知识体系。库的文档往往也无法帮助你去了解它的函数，不信的话可以看一下这个：

Rx.Observable.prototype.flatMapLatest(selector, [thisArg])Rx.Observable.prototype.flatMapLatest(selector, [thisArg])

Projects each element of an observable sequence into a new sequence of observable sequences by incorporating the element's index and then transforms an observable sequence of observable sequences into an observable sequence producing values only from the most recent observable sequence.通过加入元素的索引，将一个可观察序列的每个元素投射到一个新的可观察序列中，然后将一个可观察序列的可观察序列转变为一个只从最近的可观察序列中产生值的可观察序列。

Holy cow.我的天啊。

I've read two books, one just painted the big picture, while the other dived into how to use the Reactive library. I ended up learning Reactive Programming the hard way: figuring it out while building with it. At my work in Futurice I got to use it in a real project, and had the support of some colleagues when I ran into troubles.我读了两本书，一本只是描绘了大局，而另一本则深入研究了如何使用 Reactive library （响应式编程库）。我最终以艰难的方式学习了 Reactive 编程：在使用它的过程中摸索出来。在 Futurice 的工作中，我在一个真正的项目中使用了它，并且在我遇到困难时得到了一些同事的支持。

The hardest part of the learning journey is thinking in Reactive. It's a lot about letting go of old imperative and stateful habits of typical programming, and forcing your brain to work in a different paradigm. I haven't found any guide on the internet in this aspect, and I think the world deserves a practical tutorial on how to think in Reactive, so that you can get started. Library documentation can light your way after that. I hope this helps you.学习过程中最困难的部分是用 Reactive 思考。这需要放下典型编程中旧的命令式和状态式的习惯，并迫使你的大脑在不同的范式下工作。我还没有在互联网上找到这方面的指南，我认为这个世界应该有一本关于如何用 Reactive 思考的实用教程，这样你就可以开始了。之后图书馆的文档可以照亮你的路。我希望这能帮助你。

"What is Reactive Programming?""什么是反应式编程？"

There are plenty of bad explanations and definitions out there on the internet. Wikipedia is too generic and theoretical as usual. Stackoverflow's canonical answer is obviously not suitable for newcomers. Reactive Manifesto sounds like the kind of thing you show to your project manager or the businessmen at your company. Microsoft's Rx terminology "Rx = Observables + LINQ + Schedulers" is so heavy and Microsoftish that most of us are left confused. Terms like "reactive" and "propagation of change" don't convey anything specifically different to what your typical MV* and favorite language already does. Of course my framework views react to the models. Of course change is propagated. If it wouldn't, nothing would be rendered.互联网上有很多不好的解释和定义。 Wikipedia 一如既往的空泛与理论化。 Stackoverflow 的典范答案显然不适合新人。 Reactive Manifesto 听起来像是你给你的项目经理或你公司的商人看的那种东西。微软的 Rx terminology "Rx=Observables + LINQ + Schedulers" 太过沉重且微软浓度过高，只会让大部分人困惑。相对于你所使用的 MV* 框架以及钟爱的编程语言，"Reactive" 和 "Propagation of change" 这些术语并没有传达任何有意义的概念。框架的 Views 层当然要对 Models 层作出反应，改变当然会传播。如果没有这些，就没有东西会被渲染了。

So let's cut the bullshit.所以让我们少说点废话吧。

Reactive programming is programming with asynchronous data streams.反应式编程是用异步数据流编程。

In a way, this isn't anything new. Event buses or your typical click events are really an asynchronous event stream, on which you can observe and do some side effects. Reactive is that idea on steroids. You are able to create data streams of anything, not just from click and hover events. Streams are cheap and ubiquitous, anything can be a stream: variables, user inputs, properties, caches, data structures, etc. For example, imagine your Twitter feed would be a data stream in the same fashion that click events are. You can listen to that stream and react accordingly.一方面，这并不是什么新东西。 Event buses （事件总线）或者 Click events （点击事件）本质上就是异步事件流，你可以监听并处理这些事件。 Reactive （反应式）就是这种想法的强化体。你能够创建任何东西的数据流，而不仅仅是来自点击和悬停事件。 Stream （流）很廉价，而且无处不在，任何东西都可以成为流：变量、用户输入、属性、缓存、数据结构等等。例如，想象一下，你的 Twitter feed 将是一个数据流，就像是点击事件那样，你可以监听它并作出相应的反应（响应）。

On top of that, you are given an amazing toolbox of functions to combine, create and filter any of those streams. That's where the "functional" magic kicks in. A stream can be used as an input to another one. Even multiple streams can be used as inputs to another stream. You can merge two streams. You can filter a stream to get another one that has only those events you are interested in. You can map data values from one stream to another new one.除此之外，你还获得了一整箱的函数，可以惊艳地组合、创建和过滤任何这些数据流。这就是 "函数式" 的神奇之处。一个流可以成为另一个流的输入数据。甚至多个流也可以被用作另一个流的多个输入数据。你可以 merge （合并）两个流。你可以 filter （过滤）一个流来得到另一个只有你感兴趣的事件的流。你可以将一个数据值的 stream （流） map （映射）为另一个新的流。

If streams are so central to Reactive, let's take a careful look at them, starting with our familiar "clicks on a button" event stream.如果流是 Reactive 的核心，让我们仔细看看它们，从我们熟悉的 "点击按钮" 事件流开始。

A stream is a sequence of ongoing events ordered in time. It can emit three different things: a value (of some type), an error, or a "completed" signal. Consider that the "completed" takes place, for instance, when the current window or view containing that button is closed.流就是一个按时间排序的 ongoing events （持续事件）的序列。它可以发出三种不同的东西：一个值（某种类型），一个错误，或一个 "完成" 信号。这里考虑上了 "完成" 的发生时机，例如，当包含这个按钮的窗口或者视图被关闭时。

We capture these emitted events only asynchronously, by defining a function that will execute when a value is emitted, another function when an error is emitted, and another function when 'completed' is emitted. Sometimes these last two can be omitted and you can just focus on defining the function for values. The "listening" to the stream is called subscribing. The functions we are defining are observers. The stream is the subject (or "observable") being observed. This is precisely the Observer Design Pattern.我们捕获这些 emitted （被排放出的）事件——只是异步地——通过分别为 value 、 error 、 "completed" 三种事件定义事件处理函数。有时后两个可以省略，你可以只专注于定义 value （值）的函数。对流的 "监听" 被称为订阅。我们所定义的函数是观察者，流则作为客体（或者说 "可观察者" ）被观察。这正是 Observer Design Pattern （观察者设计模式）。

An alternative way of drawing that diagram is with ASCII, which we will use in some parts of this tutorial:另一种绘制该图的方法是用 ASCII ，我们将在本教程的某些部分使用它：（字母是值事件、 X 是错误、竖线表示 "完成" 信号、横线箭头就是这条 Stream 的时间线。）

--a---b-c---d---X---|->

a, b, c, d are emitted values
X is an error
| is the 'completed' signal
---> is the timeline

Since this feels so familiar already, and I don't want you to get bored, let's do something new: we are going to create new click event streams transformed out of the original click event stream.是不是很熟悉了？为了不让你觉得无聊，让我们做一些新的事情：基于一个「点击事件」的流转化（ transforme ）得到一个新的「点击事件」的流。

First, let's make a counter stream that indicates how many times a button was clicked. In common Reactive libraries, each stream has many functions attached to it, such as map, filter, scan, etc. When you call one of these functions, such as clickStream.map(f), it returns a new stream based on the click stream. It does not modify the original click stream in any way. This is a property called immutability, and it goes together with Reactive streams just like pancakes are good with syrup. That allows us to chain functions like clickStream.map(f).scan(g):首先，让我们做一个计数器流，用于记录一个按钮被点击了多少次。在常见的 Reactive libraries （响应式编程库）中，每个流都有许多附带的函数（即指那些用来应用于该流的函数；如 Java/Scala 里流对象的方法，或者 Python/Factor 里一个可以以流为传入参数的函数。——译者注），如 map , filter , scan , 等。当你调用这些函数中的一个，比如 clickStream.map(f) ，它会返回一个基于之前的 click stream （点击流）的新流。它不会以任何方式修改原始的点击流。这就是被称为不可变性的性质，它之于反应式流就像果汁糖浆对于薄煎饼一样（意思就是说少了就没有灵魂了——译者注）。这使得我们将能譬如 clickStream.map(f).scan(g) 这样链式地调用：

  clickStream: ---c----c--c----c------c-->
               vvvvv map(c becomes 1) vvvv
               ---1----1--1----1------1-->
               vvvvvvvvv scan(+) vvvvvvvvv
counterStream: ---1----2--3----4------5-->

The map(f) function replaces (into the new stream) each emitted value according to a function f you provide. In our case, we mapped to the number 1 on each click. The scan(g) function aggregates all previous values on the stream, producing value x = g(accumulated, current), where g was simply the add function in this example. Then, counterStream emits the total number of clicks whenever a click happens.map(f)函数根据你提供的函数f替换（到新的数据流中）每个发出的值。在我们的例子中，我们在每次点击时都会映射到数字1。scan(g)函数聚合了流中所有以前的值，产生值x = g(accumated, current)，其中g在本例中是简单的add函数。然后，每当有点击发生时，counterStream就会发出点击的总数。

To show the real power of Reactive, let's just say that you want to have a stream of "double click" events. To make it even more interesting, let's say we want the new stream to consider triple clicks as double clicks, or in general, multiple clicks (two or more). Take a deep breath and imagine how you would do that in a traditional imperative and stateful fashion. I bet it sounds fairly nasty and involves some variables to keep state and some fiddling with time intervals.为了展示Reactive的真正威力，让我们假设你想拥有一个 "双击 "事件的流。为了让它更有趣，我们假设我们想让新的流把三次点击视为两次点击，或者一般来说，多次点击（两次或多次）。深吸一口气，想象一下你将如何以传统的命令式和有状态的方式做到这一点。我打赌这听起来相当讨厌，涉及到一些变量来保持状态和一些时间间隔的摆弄。

Well, in Reactive it's pretty simple. In fact, the logic is just 4 lines of code. But let's ignore code for now. Thinking in diagrams is the best way to understand and build streams, whether you're a beginner or an expert.好吧，在Reactive中，这很简单。事实上，这个逻辑只有4行代码。但我们现在先不考虑代码。无论你是初学者还是专家，用图来思考是理解和构建流的最好方式。

Grey boxes are functions transforming one stream into another. First we accumulate clicks in lists, whenever 250 milliseconds of "event silence" has happened (that's what buffer(stream.throttle(250ms)) does, in a nutshell. Don't worry about understanding the details at this point, we are just demoing Reactive for now). The result is a stream of lists, from which we apply map() to map each list to an integer matching the length of that list. Finally, we ignore 1 integers using the filter(x >= 2) function. That's it: 3 operations to produce our intended stream. We can then subscribe ("listen") to it to react accordingly how we wish.灰色方框是将一个流转化为另一个流的函数。首先，我们在列表中积累点击次数，只要有250毫秒的 "事件沉默 "发生（这就是buffer(stream.throttle(250ms))的作用，简而言之。在这一点上不要担心理解细节，我们现在只是在演示Reactive）。其结果是一个列表流，我们应用map()将每个列表映射为与该列表长度相匹配的整数。最后，我们使用 filter(x >= 2) 函数忽略 1 的整数。就这样了。3个操作产生了我们想要的流。然后，我们可以订阅（"监听"）它，以作出我们希望的相应反应。

I hope you enjoy the beauty of this approach. This example is just the tip of the iceberg: you can apply the same operations on different kinds of streams, for instance, on a stream of API responses; on the other hand, there are many other functions available.我希望你能享受这种方法的魅力。这个例子只是冰山一角：你可以在不同种类的流上应用同样的操作，例如，在API响应流上；另一方面，还有许多其他的功能。

"Why should I consider adopting RP?""为什么我应该考虑采用RP？"

Reactive Programming raises the level of abstraction of your code so you can focus on the interdependence of events that define the business logic, rather than having to constantly fiddle with a large amount of implementation details. Code in RP will likely be more concise.反应式编程提高了你的代码的抽象水平，所以你可以专注于定义业务逻辑的事件的相互依赖性，而不是不断地摆弄大量的实现细节。RP中的代码可能会更简明。

The benefit is more evident in modern webapps and mobile apps that are highly interactive with a multitude of UI events related to data events. 10 years ago, interaction with web pages was basically about submitting a long form to the backend and performing simple rendering to the frontend. Apps have evolved to be more real-time: modifying a single form field can automatically trigger a save to the backend, "likes" to some content can be reflected in real time to other connected users, and so forth.这种好处在现代的webapp和移动app中更为明显，它们具有高度的交互性，有大量的与数据事件相关的UI事件。10年前，与网页的交互基本上是向后端提交一个长长的表单，并向前端进行简单的渲染。应用程序已经发展得更加实时：修改一个表单字段可以自动触发保存到后台，对一些内容的 "喜欢 "可以实时反映给其他连接的用户，等等。

Apps nowadays have an abundancy of real-time events of every kind that enable a highly interactive experience to the user. We need tools for properly dealing with that, and Reactive Programming is an answer.现在的应用程序有大量的各种实时事件，为用户提供了高度互动的体验。我们需要一些工具来正确处理这个问题，而反应式编程就是一个答案。

Thinking in RP, with examples用RP思考，举例说明

Let's dive into the real stuff. A real-world example with a step-by-step guide on how to think in RP. No synthetic examples, no half-explained concepts. By the end of this tutorial we will have produced real functioning code, while knowing why we did each thing.让我们深入了解一下真实的东西。一个真实世界的例子，以及如何用RP思考的一步步指南。没有合成的例子，没有半解释的概念。在本教程结束时，我们将产生真正的功能代码，同时知道我们为什么做每一件事。

I picked JavaScript and RxJS as the tools for this, for a reason: JavaScript is the most familiar language out there at the moment, and the Rx* library family is widely available for many languages and platforms (.NET, Java, Scala, Clojure, JavaScript, Ruby, Python, C++, Objective-C/Cocoa, Groovy, etc). So whatever your tools are, you can concretely benefit by following this tutorial.我选择JavaScript和RxJS作为本教程的工具是有原因的。JavaScript是目前最熟悉的语言，而Rx*库系列广泛适用于许多语言和平台（.NET、Java、Scala、Clojure、JavaScript、Ruby、Python、C++、Objective-C/Cocoa、Groovy，等等）。因此，无论你的工具是什么，你都可以通过遵循本教程具体受益。

Implementing a "Who to follow" suggestions box实现一个 "关注谁 "的建议框

In Twitter there is this UI element that suggests other accounts you could follow:在Twitter中，有这样一个UI元素，建议你可以关注其他账户。

We are going to focus on imitating its core features, which are:我们将专注于模仿它的核心功能，这就是。

  • On startup, load accounts data from the API and display 3 suggestions启动时，从API加载账户数据并显示3个建议
  • On clicking "Refresh", load 3 other account suggestions into the 3 rows点击 "刷新"，在3行中加载3个其他账户建议
  • On click 'x' button on an account row, clear only that current account and display another点击某一行的 "x "按钮，仅清除当前账户并显示另一个账户。
  • Each row displays the account's avatar and links to their page每一行都显示该账户的头像和他们的页面链接。

We can leave out the other features and buttons because they are minor. And, instead of Twitter, which recently closed its API to the unauthorized public, let's build that UI for following people on Github. There's a Github API for getting users.我们可以不提其他的功能和按钮，因为它们是次要的。而且，与其说Twitter最近向未经授权的公众关闭了它的API，不如说我们为关注Github上的人建立这种UI。有一个Github的API用于获取用户。

The complete code for this is ready at http://jsfiddle.net/staltz/8jFJH/48/ in case you want to take a peak already.这方面的完整代码已经在http://jsfiddle.net/staltz/8jFJH/48/，如果你已经想看一下的话。

Request and response请求和响应

How do you approach this problem with Rx? Well, to start with, (almost) everything can be a stream. That's the Rx mantra. Let's start with the easiest feature: "on startup, load 3 accounts data from the API". There is nothing special here, this is simply about (1) doing a request, (2) getting a response, (3) rendering the response. So let's go ahead and represent our requests as a stream. At first this will feel like overkill, but we need to start from the basics, right?你如何用Rx处理这个问题？嗯，首先，（几乎）所有的东西都可以是一个流。这就是Rx的口号。让我们从最简单的功能开始。"启动时，从API加载3个账户数据"。这里没有什么特别的，这只是关于（1）做一个请求，（2）得到一个响应，（3）渲染这个响应。因此，让我们继续把我们的请求表现为一个流。一开始，我们会觉得这样做是多余的，但我们需要从最基本的开始，对吗？

On startup we need to do only one request, so if we model it as a data stream, it will be a stream with only one emitted value. Later, we know we will have many requests happening, but for now, it is just one.在启动时，我们只需要做一个请求，所以如果我们把它建模为一个数据流，它将是一个只有一个发射值的流。后来，我们知道我们会有很多请求发生，但现在，它只是一个。

--a------|->

Where a is the string 'https://api.github.com/users'

This is a stream of URLs that we want to request. Whenever a request event happens, it tells us two things: when and what. "When" the request should be executed is when the event is emitted. And "what" should be requested is the value emitted: a string containing the URL.这是一个我们想要请求的URL的流。每当一个请求事件发生时，它告诉我们两件事：何时和什么。请求的 "何时 "应该被执行就是事件被发出的时间。而 "什么 "应该被请求的是发出的值：一个包含URL的字符串。

To create such stream with a single value is very simple in Rx*. The official terminology for a stream is "Observable", for the fact that it can be observed, but I find it to be a silly name, so I call it stream.在Rx*中，创建这种带有单个值的流是非常简单的。流的官方术语是 "Observable"，因为它可以被观察到，但我觉得这是个愚蠢的名字，所以我叫它流。

var requestStream = Rx.Observable.just('https://api.github.com/users');

But now, that is just a stream of strings, doing no other operation, so we need to somehow make something happen when that value is emitted. That's done by subscribing to the stream.但是现在，这只是一个字符串的流，没有做其他的操作，所以我们需要在这个值被发射出来的时候，以某种方式让一些事情发生。这可以通过订阅流来实现。

requestStream.subscribe(function(requestUrl) {
  // execute the request
  jQuery.getJSON(requestUrl, function(responseData) {
    // ...
  });
}

Notice we are using a jQuery Ajax callback (which we assume you should know already) to handle the asynchronicity of the request operation. But wait a moment, Rx is for dealing with asynchronous data streams. Couldn't the response for that request be a stream containing the data arriving at some time in the future? Well, at a conceptual level, it sure looks like it, so let's try that.注意，我们正在使用一个jQuery Ajax回调（我们认为你应该已经知道）来处理请求操作的异步性。但是等一下，Rx是用来处理异步数据流的。该请求的响应不可能是一个包含在未来某个时间到达的数据流吗？好吧，在概念层面上，它看起来确实如此，所以让我们试试。

requestStream.subscribe(function(requestUrl) {
  // execute the request
  var responseStream = Rx.Observable.create(function (observer) {
    jQuery.getJSON(requestUrl)
    .done(function(response) { observer.onNext(response); })
    .fail(function(jqXHR, status, error) { observer.onError(error); })
    .always(function() { observer.onCompleted(); });
  });
  
  responseStream.subscribe(function(response) {
    // do something with the response
  });
}

What Rx.Observable.create() does is create your own custom stream by explicitly informing each observer (or in other words, a "subscriber") about data events (onNext()) or errors (onError()). What we did was just wrap that jQuery Ajax Promise. Excuse me, does this mean that a Promise is an Observable?Rx.Observable.create()所做的是通过明确通知每个观察者（或者换句话说，一个 "订阅者"）关于数据事件（onNext()）或错误（onError()）来创建你自己的流。我们所做的只是包裹那个jQuery Ajax Promise。对不起，这是否意味着Promise是一个Observable？

         

Yes.是的。

Observable is Promise++. In Rx you can easily convert a Promise to an Observable by doing var stream = Rx.Observable.fromPromise(promise), so let's use that. The only difference is that Observables are not Promises/A+ compliant, but conceptually there is no clash. A Promise is simply an Observable with one single emitted value. Rx streams go beyond promises by allowing many returned values.可观察的是Promise++。在Rx中，你可以通过var stream = Rx.Observable.fromPromise(promise)轻松地将一个Promise转换成一个Observable，所以让我们使用这个方法。唯一的区别是，Observables不符合Promise/A+的要求，但在概念上并没有冲突。一个Promise只是一个具有单一发射值的Observable。Rx流通过允许许多返回值而超越了Promise。

This is pretty nice, and shows how Observables are at least as powerful as Promises. So if you believe the Promises hype, keep an eye on what Rx Observables are capable of.这很好，说明了Observable至少和Promise一样强大。因此，如果你相信承诺的炒作，请留意Rx观察者的能力。

Now back to our example, if you were quick to notice, we have one subscribe() call inside another, which is somewhat akin to callback hell. Also, the creation of responseStream is dependent on requestStream. As you heard before, in Rx there are simple mechanisms for transforming and creating new streams out of others, so we should be doing that.现在回到我们的例子，如果你很快注意到，我们有一个subscribe()调用在另一个里面，这有点类似于回调地狱。另外，responseStream的创建依赖于requestStream。正如你之前听到的，在Rx中，有一些简单的机制来转换和创建其他的流，所以我们应该这样做。

The one basic function that you should know by now is map(f), which takes each value of stream A, applies f() on it, and produces a value on stream B. If we do that to our request and response streams, we can map request URLs to response Promises (disguised as streams).你现在应该知道的一个基本函数是map(f)，它接收流A的每个值，对其应用f()，并在流B上产生一个值。如果我们对我们的请求流和响应流这样做，我们可以将请求URL映射到响应Promises（伪装成流）。

var responseMetastream = requestStream
  .map(function(requestUrl) {
    return Rx.Observable.fromPromise(jQuery.getJSON(requestUrl));
  });

Then we will have created a beast called "metastream": a stream of streams. Don't panic yet. A metastream is a stream where each emitted value is yet another stream. You can think of it as pointers: each emitted value is a pointer to another stream. In our example, each request URL is mapped to a pointer to the promise stream containing the corresponding response.然后，我们将创建一个叫做 "metastream "的野兽：一个流的流。先不要惊慌。一个metastream是一个流，其中每个发射的值都是另一个流。你可以把它想象成指针：每个发射的值都是一个指向另一个流的指针。在我们的例子中，每个请求的URL都被映射到一个指向包含相应响应的承诺流的指针。

A metastream for responses looks confusing, and doesn't seem to help us at all. We just want a simple stream of responses, where each emitted value is a JSON object, not a 'Promise' of a JSON object. Say hi to Mr. Flatmap: a version of map() that "flattens" a metastream, by emitting on the "trunk" stream everything that will be emitted on "branch" streams. Flatmap is not a "fix" and metastreams are not a bug, these are really the tools for dealing with asynchronous responses in Rx.响应的metastream看起来很混乱，而且似乎对我们没有任何帮助。我们只是想要一个简单的响应流，其中每个发射的值是一个JSON对象，而不是一个JSON对象的 "承诺"。向Flatmap先生问好：map()的一个版本，通过在 "主干 "流中发射将在 "分支 "流中发射的所有内容，"扁平化 "了元数据流。Flatmap不是一个 "修复"，metastreams也不是一个bug，这些都是处理Rx中异步响应的真正工具。

var responseStream = requestStream
  .flatMap(function(requestUrl) {
    return Rx.Observable.fromPromise(jQuery.getJSON(requestUrl));
  });

Nice. And because the response stream is defined according to request stream, if we have later on more events happening on request stream, we will have the corresponding response events happening on response stream, as expected:不错。因为响应流是根据请求流定义的，如果我们以后有更多的事件发生在请求流上，我们将有相应的响应事件发生在响应流上，正如预期的那样。

requestStream:  --a-----b--c------------|->
responseStream: -----A--------B-----C---|->

(lowercase is a request, uppercase is its response)

Now that we finally have a response stream, we can render the data we receive:现在，我们终于有了一个响应流，我们可以渲染我们收到的数据。

responseStream.subscribe(function(response) {
  // render `response` to the DOM however you wish
});

Joining all the code until now, we have:将所有的代码连接到现在，我们有。

var requestStream = Rx.Observable.just('https://api.github.com/users');

var responseStream = requestStream
  .flatMap(function(requestUrl) {
    return Rx.Observable.fromPromise(jQuery.getJSON(requestUrl));
  });

responseStream.subscribe(function(response) {
  // render `response` to the DOM however you wish
});

The refresh button刷新按钮

I did not yet mention that the JSON in the response is a list with 100 users. The API only allows us to specify the page offset, and not the page size, so we're using just 3 data objects and wasting 97 others. We can ignore that problem for now, since later on we will see how to cache the responses.我还没有提到，响应中的JSON是一个有100个用户的列表。API只允许我们指定页面偏移量，而不是页面大小，所以我们只用了3个数据对象，而浪费了另外97个。我们现在可以忽略这个问题，因为后面我们会看到如何缓存响应。

Everytime the refresh button is clicked, the request stream should emit a new URL, so that we can get a new response. We need two things: a stream of click events on the refresh button (mantra: anything can be a stream), and we need to change the request stream to depend on the refresh click stream. Gladly, RxJS comes with tools to make Observables from event listeners.每次点击刷新按钮时，请求流应该发出一个新的URL，这样我们就可以得到一个新的响应。我们需要两样东西：一个关于刷新按钮的点击事件流（咒语：任何东西都可以是一个流），以及我们需要改变请求流以依赖刷新点击流。很高兴的是，RxJS提供了一些工具来从事件监听器中制作Observables。

var refreshButton = document.querySelector('.refresh');
var refreshClickStream = Rx.Observable.fromEvent(refreshButton, 'click');

Since the refresh click event doesn't itself carry any API URL, we need to map each click to an actual URL. Now we change the request stream to be the refresh click stream mapped to the API endpoint with a random offset parameter each time.由于刷新点击事件本身并没有携带任何API URL，我们需要将每次点击映射到一个实际的URL。现在我们改变请求流，将刷新点击流映射到API端点，每次都有一个随机偏移参数。

var requestStream = refreshClickStream
  .map(function() {
    var randomOffset = Math.floor(Math.random()*500);
    return 'https://api.github.com/users?since=' + randomOffset;
  });

Because I'm dumb and I don't have automated tests, I just broke one of our previously built features. A request doesn't happen anymore on startup, it happens only when the refresh is clicked. Urgh. I need both behaviors: a request when either a refresh is clicked or the webpage was just opened.因为我很笨，也没有自动测试，所以我刚刚破坏了我们之前建立的一个功能。请求不再发生在启动时，它只发生在点击刷新时。呃。我需要这两种行为：当点击刷新或刚打开网页时都会有请求。

We know how to make a separate stream for each one of those cases:我们知道如何为这些情况中的每一种制作一个单独的流。

var requestOnRefreshStream = refreshClickStream
  .map(function() {
    var randomOffset = Math.floor(Math.random()*500);
    return 'https://api.github.com/users?since=' + randomOffset;
  });
  
var startupRequestStream = Rx.Observable.just('https://api.github.com/users');

But how can we "merge" these two into one? Well, there's merge(). Explained in the diagram dialect, this is what it does:但是我们怎样才能将这两种情况 "合并 "成一个？好吧，这就是merge()。用方言解释一下，这就是它的作用。

stream A: ---a--------e-----o----->
stream B: -----B---C-----D-------->
          vvvvvvvvv merge vvvvvvvvv
          ---a-B---C--e--D--o----->

It should be easy now:现在应该很容易了。

var requestOnRefreshStream = refreshClickStream
  .map(function() {
    var randomOffset = Math.floor(Math.random()*500);
    return 'https://api.github.com/users?since=' + randomOffset;
  });
  
var startupRequestStream = Rx.Observable.just('https://api.github.com/users');

var requestStream = Rx.Observable.merge(
  requestOnRefreshStream, startupRequestStream
);

There is an alternative and cleaner way of writing that, without the intermediate streams.有一个替代的、更干净的方法来写这个，没有中间流。

var requestStream = refreshClickStream
  .map(function() {
    var randomOffset = Math.floor(Math.random()*500);
    return 'https://api.github.com/users?since=' + randomOffset;
  })
  .merge(Rx.Observable.just('https://api.github.com/users'));

Even shorter, even more readable:更短，更易读。

var requestStream = refreshClickStream
  .map(function() {
    var randomOffset = Math.floor(Math.random()*500);
    return 'https://api.github.com/users?since=' + randomOffset;
  })
  .startWith('https://api.github.com/users');

The startWith() function does exactly what you think it does. No matter how your input stream looks like, the output stream resulting of startWith(x) will have x at the beginning. But I'm not DRY enough, I'm repeating the API endpoint string. One way to fix this is by moving the startWith() close to the refreshClickStream, to essentially "emulate" a refresh click on startup.startWith()函数所做的正是你认为它所做的。无论你的输入流是什么样子，startWith(x)产生的输出流都会有x在开头。但我还不够干脆，我在重复API端点的字符串。解决这个问题的一个方法是把startWith()移到refreshClickStream附近，以便在启动时基本上 "模拟 "一次刷新点击。

var requestStream = refreshClickStream.startWith('startup click')
  .map(function() {
    var randomOffset = Math.floor(Math.random()*500);
    return 'https://api.github.com/users?since=' + randomOffset;
  });

Nice. If you go back to the point where I "broke the automated tests", you should see that the only difference with this last approach is that I added the startWith().很好。如果你回到我 "破坏了自动化测试 "的地方，你应该看到，最后这个方法的唯一区别是我添加了startWith()。

Modelling the 3 suggestions with streams用流来建立3个建议的模型

Until now, we have only touched a suggestion UI element on the rendering step that happens in the responseStream's subscribe(). Now with the refresh button, we have a problem: as soon as you click 'refresh', the current 3 suggestions are not cleared. New suggestions come in only after a response has arrived, but to make the UI look nice, we need to clean out the current suggestions when clicks happen on the refresh.到目前为止，我们只在responseStream的subscribe()中发生的渲染步骤上接触了一个建议UI元素。现在有了刷新按钮，我们有一个问题：只要你点击'刷新'，当前的3个建议就不会被清除。新的建议只有在响应到达后才会出现，但为了使用户界面看起来漂亮，我们需要在点击刷新时清除当前建议。

refreshClickStream.subscribe(function() {
  // clear the 3 suggestion DOM elements 
});

No, not so fast, pal. This is bad, because we now have two subscribers that affect the suggestion DOM elements (the other one being responseStream.subscribe()), and that doesn't really sound like Separation of concerns. Remember the Reactive mantra?不，不要这么快，伙计。这很糟糕，因为我们现在有两个影响建议DOM元素的订阅者（另一个是responseStream.subscribe()），而这听起来并不像关注点分离。还记得Reactive的口号吗？

       

So let's model a suggestion as a stream, where each emitted value is the JSON object containing the suggestion data. We will do this separately for each of the 3 suggestions. This is how the stream for suggestion #1 could look like:因此，让我们把建议建模为一个流，其中每个发射的值是包含建议数据的JSON对象。我们将为3条建议中的每一条分别做这件事。这就是1号建议的流的模样。

var suggestion1Stream = responseStream
  .map(function(listUsers) {
    // get one random user from the list
    return listUsers[Math.floor(Math.random()*listUsers.length)];
  });

The others, suggestion2Stream and suggestion3Stream can be simply copy pasted from suggestion1Stream. This is not DRY, but it will keep our example simple for this tutorial, plus I think it's a good exercise to think how to avoid repetition in this case.其他的， suggestion2Stream 和 suggestion3Stream 可以简单地从 suggestion1Stream 中复制粘贴。这并不是干货，但它将使我们的例子在本教程中保持简单，而且我认为这是一个很好的练习，以思考如何避免在这种情况下的重复性。

Instead of having the rendering happen in responseStream's subscribe(), we do that here:我们没有让渲染发生在 responseStream 的 subscribe() 中，而是在这里做。

suggestion1Stream.subscribe(function(suggestion) {
  // render the 1st suggestion to the DOM
});

Back to the "on refresh, clear the suggestions", we can simply map refresh clicks to null suggestion data, and include that in the suggestion1Stream, as such:回到 "刷新时，清除建议"，我们可以简单地将刷新点击映射为null建议数据，并将其包含在 suggestion1Stream 中。

var suggestion1Stream = responseStream
  .map(function(listUsers) {
    // get one random user from the list
    return listUsers[Math.floor(Math.random()*listUsers.length)];
  })
  .merge(
    refreshClickStream.map(function(){ return null; })
  );

And when rendering, we interpret null as "no data", hence hiding its UI element.在渲染的时候，我们把null解释为 "没有数据"，从而隐藏它的UI元素。

suggestion1Stream.subscribe(function(suggestion) {
  if (suggestion === null) {
    // hide the first suggestion DOM element
  }
  else {
    // show the first suggestion DOM element
    // and render the data
  }
});

The big picture is now:现在的大形势是。

refreshClickStream: ----------o--------o---->
     requestStream: -r--------r--------r---->
    responseStream: ----R---------R------R-->   
 suggestion1Stream: ----s-----N---s----N-s-->
 suggestion2Stream: ----q-----N---q----N-q-->
 suggestion3Stream: ----t-----N---t----N-t-->

Where N stands for null.其中N代表null。

As a bonus, we can also render "empty" suggestions on startup. That is done by adding startWith(null) to the suggestion streams:作为奖励，我们也可以在启动时渲染 "空 "建议。这可以通过在建议流中添加startWith(null)来实现。

var suggestion1Stream = responseStream
  .map(function(listUsers) {
    // get one random user from the list
    return listUsers[Math.floor(Math.random()*listUsers.length)];
  })
  .merge(
    refreshClickStream.map(function(){ return null; })
  )
  .startWith(null);

Which results in:其结果是。

refreshClickStream: ----------o---------o---->
     requestStream: -r--------r---------r---->
    responseStream: ----R----------R------R-->   
 suggestion1Stream: -N--s-----N----s----N-s-->
 suggestion2Stream: -N--q-----N----q----N-q-->
 suggestion3Stream: -N--t-----N----t----N-t-->

Closing a suggestion and using cached responses关闭一个建议并使用缓存的响应

There is one feature remaining to implement. Each suggestion should have its own 'x' button for closing it, and loading another in its place. At first thought, you could say it's enough to make a new request when any close button is clicked:还有一个功能需要实现。每个建议都应该有自己的 "x "按钮，用于关闭它，并在其位置上加载另一个建议。乍一看，你可以说当任何关闭按钮被点击时，提出一个新的请求就足够了。

var close1Button = document.querySelector('.close1');
var close1ClickStream = Rx.Observable.fromEvent(close1Button, 'click');
// and the same for close2Button and close3Button

var requestStream = refreshClickStream.startWith('startup click')
  .merge(close1ClickStream) // we added this
  .map(function() {
    var randomOffset = Math.floor(Math.random()*500);
    return 'https://api.github.com/users?since=' + randomOffset;
  });

That does not work. It will close and reload all suggestions, rather than just only the one we clicked on. There are a couple of different ways of solving this, and to keep it interesting, we will solve it by reusing previous responses. The API's response page size is 100 users while we were using just 3 of those, so there is plenty of fresh data available. No need to request more.这并不可行。它将关闭并重新加载所有的建议，而不仅仅是我们所点击的那个。有几种不同的方法来解决这个问题，为了保持有趣，我们将通过重复使用以前的响应来解决这个问题。API的响应页面大小是100个用户，而我们只用了其中的3个，所以有大量的新鲜数据可用。不需要请求更多。

Again, let's think in streams. When a 'close1' click event happens, we want to use the most recently emitted response on responseStream to get one random user from the list in the response. As such:再一次，让我们用流来思考。当'close1'点击事件发生时，我们想使用最近在responseStream上发出的响应，从响应的列表中获得一个随机用户。就像这样。

    requestStream: --r--------------->
   responseStream: ------R----------->
close1ClickStream: ------------c----->
suggestion1Stream: ------s-----s----->

In Rx* there is a combinator function called combineLatest that seems to do what we need. It takes two streams A and B as inputs, and whenever either stream emits a value, combineLatest joins the two most recently emitted values a and b from both streams and outputs a value c = f(x,y), where f is a function you define. It is better explained with a diagram:在Rx*中，有一个叫 combineLatest的组合函数，似乎可以做我们需要的事情。它把两个流A和B作为输入，每当任何一个流发出一个值，combinedLatest就把两个流中最近发出的两个值a和b连接起来，输出一个值c=f(x,y)，其中f是你定义的一个函数。用一张图来解释会更好。

stream A: --a-----------e--------i-------->
stream B: -----b----c--------d-------q---->
          vvvvvvvv combineLatest(f) vvvvvvv
          ----AB---AC--EC---ED--ID--IQ---->

where f is the uppercase function

We can apply combineLatest() on close1ClickStream and responseStream, so that whenever the close 1 button is clicked, we get the latest response emitted and produce a new value on suggestion1Stream. On the other hand, combineLatest() is symmetric: whenever a new response is emitted on responseStream, it will combine with the latest 'close 1' click to produce a new suggestion. That is interesting, because it allows us to simplify our previous code for suggestion1Stream, like this:我们可以在close1ClickStream和responseStream上应用combinedLatest()，这样，每当close1按钮被点击时，我们就会得到最新发出的响应，并在suggest1Stream上产生一个新值。另一方面，combinedLatest()是对称的：每当在responseStream上发出一个新的响应，它将与最近的 "close 1 "点击结合起来，产生一个新的建议。这很有趣，因为它允许我们简化之前的 suggestion1Stream 的代码，像这样。

var suggestion1Stream = close1ClickStream
  .combineLatest(responseStream,             
    function(click, listUsers) {
      return listUsers[Math.floor(Math.random()*listUsers.length)];
    }
  )
  .merge(
    refreshClickStream.map(function(){ return null; })
  )
  .startWith(null);

One piece is still missing in the puzzle. The combineLatest() uses the most recent of the two sources, but if one of those sources hasn't emitted anything yet, combineLatest() cannot produce a data event on the output stream. If you look at the ASCII diagram above, you will see that the output has nothing when the first stream emitted value a. Only when the second stream emitted value b could it produce an output value.拼图中还缺少一块。combineLatest()使用了两个源中最近的一个，但是如果其中一个源还没有发出任何东西， combineLatest()就不能在输出流上产生一个数据事件。如果你看一下上面的ASCII图，你会发现，当第一个流发射出值a时，输出没有任何东西，只有当第二个流发射出值b时，它才能产生一个输出值。

There are different ways of solving this, and we will stay with the simplest one, which is simulating a click to the 'close 1' button on startup:有不同的方法来解决这个问题，我们将采用最简单的方法，即模拟启动时点击 "关闭1 "按钮。

var suggestion1Stream = close1ClickStream.startWith('startup click') // we added this
  .combineLatest(responseStream,             
    function(click, listUsers) {l
      return listUsers[Math.floor(Math.random()*listUsers.length)];
    }
  )
  .merge(
    refreshClickStream.map(function(){ return null; })
  )
  .startWith(null);

Wrapping up收尾工作

And we're done. The complete code for all this was:我们已经完成了。这一切的完整代码是。

var refreshButton = document.querySelector('.refresh');
var refreshClickStream = Rx.Observable.fromEvent(refreshButton, 'click');

var closeButton1 = document.querySelector('.close1');
var close1ClickStream = Rx.Observable.fromEvent(closeButton1, 'click');
// and the same logic for close2 and close3

var requestStream = refreshClickStream.startWith('startup click')
  .map(function() {
    var randomOffset = Math.floor(Math.random()*500);
    return 'https://api.github.com/users?since=' + randomOffset;
  });

var responseStream = requestStream
  .flatMap(function (requestUrl) {
    return Rx.Observable.fromPromise($.ajax({url: requestUrl}));
  });

var suggestion1Stream = close1ClickStream.startWith('startup click')
  .combineLatest(responseStream,             
    function(click, listUsers) {
      return listUsers[Math.floor(Math.random()*listUsers.length)];
    }
  )
  .merge(
    refreshClickStream.map(function(){ return null; })
  )
  .startWith(null);
// and the same logic for suggestion2Stream and suggestion3Stream

suggestion1Stream.subscribe(function(suggestion) {
  if (suggestion === null) {
    // hide the first suggestion DOM element
  }
  else {
    // show the first suggestion DOM element
    // and render the data
  }
});

You can see this working example at http://jsfiddle.net/staltz/8jFJH/48/你可以在http://jsfiddle.net/staltz/8jFJH/48/ 上看到这个工作实例

That piece of code is small but dense: it features management of multiple events with proper separation of concerns, and even caching of responses. The functional style made the code look more declarative than imperative: we are not giving a sequence of instructions to execute, we are just telling what something is by defining relationships between streams. For instance, with Rx we told the computer that suggestion1Stream is the 'close 1' stream combined with one user from the latest response, besides being null when a refresh happens or program startup happened.这段代码很小，但很密集：它的特点是对多个事件的管理，有适当的关注点分离，甚至还有响应的缓存。功能性的风格使代码看起来更像是声明性的，而不是命令性的：我们没有给出要执行的指令序列，我们只是通过定义流之间的关系来告诉什么东西。例如，通过Rx，我们告诉计算机， suggestion1Stream是 "关闭1 "的流，与最新的响应中的一个用户相结合，此外，当刷新发生或程序启动时，它是空的。

Notice also the impressive absence of control flow elements such as if, for, while, and the typical callback-based control flow that you expect from a JavaScript application. You can even get rid of the if and else in the subscribe() above by using filter() if you want (I'll leave the implementation details to you as an exercise). In Rx, we have stream functions such as map, filter, scan, merge, combineLatest, startWith, and many more to control the flow of an event-driven program. This toolset of functions gives you more power in less code.还要注意到令人印象深刻的控制流元素的缺失，如if、for、while，以及你所期望的JavaScript应用程序中典型的基于回调的控制流。如果你愿意，你甚至可以通过使用filter()来摆脱上面subscribe()中的if和else（我将把实现细节留给你作为练习）。在Rx中，我们有map、filter、scan、merge、combinedLatest、startWith等流函数来控制事件驱动程序的流程。这个函数集在更少的代码中给了你更多的力量。

What comes next下一步是什么

If you think Rx* will be your preferred library for Reactive Programming, take a while to get acquainted with the big list of functions for transforming, combining, and creating Observables. If you want to understand those functions in diagrams of streams, take a look at RxJava's very useful documentation with marble diagrams. Whenever you get stuck trying to do something, draw those diagrams, think on them, look at the long list of functions, and think more. This workflow has been effective in my experience.如果你认为Rx*会成为你的反应式编程的首选库，那就花点时间熟悉一下用于转换、组合和创建Observables的一大串函数。如果你想通过流图来理解这些函数，可以看看RxJava的大理石图的非常有用的文档。每当你在尝试做某件事时遇到困难，就画出这些图，在上面思考，看看长长的函数列表，然后再思考。根据我的经验，这种工作流程是有效的。

Once you start getting the hang of programming with Rx*, it is absolutely required to understand the concept of Cold vs Hot Observables. If you ignore this, it will come back and bite you brutally. You have been warned. Sharpen your skills further by learning real functional programming, and getting acquainted with issues such as side effects that affect Rx*.一旦你开始掌握用Rx*编程的技巧，就绝对需要理解冷与热观察者的概念。如果你忽视了这一点，它就会回来狠狠地咬你一口。你已经被警告了。通过学习真正的函数式编程来进一步磨练你的技能，并熟悉影响Rx*的副作用等问题。

But Reactive Programming is not just Rx*. There is Bacon.js which is intuitive to work with, without the quirks you sometimes encounter in Rx*. The Elm Language lives in its own category: it's a Functional Reactive Programming language that compiles to JavaScript + HTML + CSS, and features a time travelling debugger. Pretty awesome.但反应式编程不仅仅是Rx*。还有Bacon.js，它工作起来很直观，没有你有时在Rx*中遇到的怪癖。Elm语言有自己的特点：它是一种功能性的反应式编程语言，可以编译成JavaScript+HTML+CSS，并具有时间旅行调试器。相当棒。

Rx works great for event-heavy frontends and apps. But it is not just a client-side thing, it works great also in the backend and close to databases. In fact, RxJava is a key component for enabling server-side concurrency in Netflix's API. Rx is not a framework restricted to one specific type of application or language. It really is a paradigm that you can use when programming any event-driven software.Rx对于事件繁多的前台和应用程序来说非常有用。但它不仅仅是客户端的东西，它在后端和接近数据库的地方也很好用。事实上，RxJava是在Netflix的API中实现服务器端并发的一个关键组件。Rx不是一个局限于某种特定类型的应用程序或语言的框架。它确实是一种范式，你可以在编程任何事件驱动的软件时使用。

If this tutorial helped you, tweet it forward.如果本教程对你有帮助，请在推特上转发。

Copy link
Author

staltz commented Jun 30, 2014

Hi @swanson, sorry for that section, I might have gone a bit too fast near the end.

Try not to think of the suggestion stream as "UI element stream". It is a data stream in the sense that everything it emits is simply data. Although, as you noticed, it is tightly linked to the close button click stream, and also tightly linked to the response stream. In a way, it lives between Model and View, if you think about an MVC framework.

In fact, suggestion stream is best understood as a ViewModel in the MVVM architecture. MVVM happens to be a good fit for Rx*. Quoting Wikipedia:

The view model of MVVM is a value converter meaning that the view model is responsible for exposing the data objects from the model in such a way that those objects are easily managed and consumed. In this respect, the view model is more model than view, and handles most if not all of the view’s display logic.

Suggestion stream prepares data coming from the model (response stream) in such a way that the data it emits can be immediately consumed by the View (the subscriber which renders to the DOM). It frees the View from having to do any kind of logic.

If we had followed MVVM strictly in this example, we would need also a close1ClickViewModelStream just to detach the suggestion stream from close1ClickStream, and it would be defined as such: close1ClickViewModelStream = close1ClickStream.startWith('startup click').

Programming with Rx* doesn't require MVVM, but I've found it to be a good architecture.

Is there a concept of some independent thing emitting an event to hook into the stream? I guess I am more used to a traditional event bus, where a SuggestionViewModel might emit SuggestionRemoved event which would trigger the API stream to go get some new data. And the view model might want to subscribe to a NewSuggestion event to render the new data. My natural feeling is that a view/view model should not care about the internals of how the data was loaded, that I am using a stream, etc and the approach you outlined seems like this is all mashed together because all the streams must be merged/connected directly.

Sorry, something went wrong.

Copy link
Author

staltz commented Jun 30, 2014

@swanson Nothing stops you from doing that kind of approach. For instance, you could do suggestionRemovedStream = close1ClickStream.startWith('startup click').

However, one hint for "thinking in the right way": avoid saying that the SuggestionRemoved event would trigger the API stream. Think the other way around: the API stream is triggered by the SuggestionRemoved. It's an important distinction because Rx is "Push" while imperative is "Pull". https://github.com/Reactive-Extensions/RxJS/tree/master/doc#rxjs-v22 It makes a difference because SuggestionRemoved will have no knowledge of the API stream. It's the API stream that can listen to ("subscribe") events from SuggestionRemoved.

The mashing together happens in the ViewModel, which is typically a class/module with a couple of streams, assuming two roles: Observer, and Observed. Events move in both directions (from Model to View and vice-versa) in the ViewModel. The benefit is that Model streams and View streams don't need to care about any other streams, they just do their thing by defining what they emit. The ViewModel glues it together.

View streams: refreshClickStream, closeClickStream
Model streams: requestStream, responseStream

@swanson That said, I recommend reading about Subjects which are streams that you can explicitly feed in new events, imperative-style:

subject.onNext("suggestion removed!").

Author

staltz commented Jun 30, 2014

Very good catch @queimadus! We were just bitten by the Cold vs Hot Observable problem, that I hoped wouldn't show up in this demo, but it did.

It happened because responseStream was a cold observable (observables are cold by default), and it had 3 observers suggestion1Stream, suggestion2Stream, and suggestion3Stream. Essentially, these 3 create their own internal response stream, and that's what causes the 3 API requests.

To fix it, we made responseStream become a hot observable:

var responseStream = requestStream
    .flatMap(function (requestUrl) {
        return Rx.Observable.fromPromise($.getJSON(requestUrl));
    })
    .publish().refCount();

Fixed here: http://jsfiddle.net/staltz/8jFJH/59/

As far as I've seen, this is the best example-based explanation of Cold vs Hot: http://leecampbell.blogspot.co.uk/2010/08/rx-part-7-hot-and-cold-observables.html
Other good references: [1] [2] [3]

peterkhayes commented Jul 1, 2014

The 'startup click' is passed to a stream that takes the same action regardless of what the input is, so it really could be anything.

var requestStream = refreshClickStream.startWith('startup click')
  .map(function() {
    var randomOffset = Math.floor(Math.random()*500);
    return 'https://api.github.com/users?since=' + randomOffset;
  });

notice that the requestStream is mapped to the link to github, without reference to any input. This is different from the usual use of map, where the iterator function uses the input in some way, like map(function(number) {return 2*number}).

I guess he's using the phrase 'startup click' here to be more descriptive. You have to pass something (or else the stream won't emit anything), so why not use something that explains why you're doing it?

Author

staltz commented Jul 1, 2014

Hi @ledbutter, actually repeat() doesn't help for that, and the DRY problem is already solved in the JSFiddle: http://jsfiddle.net/staltz/8jFJH/48/

function createSuggestionStream(closeClickStream) {
    return closeClickStream.startWith('startup click')
        .combineLatest(responseStream,             
            function(click, listUsers) {
                return listUsers[Math.floor(Math.random()*listUsers.length)];
            }
        )
        .merge(
            refreshClickStream.map(function(){ 
                return null;
            })
        )
        .startWith(null);
}

repeat() just "echoes" forward some events that happened in the past. See [1] [2]

domenic commented Jul 1, 2014

Observable is Promise++. In Rx you can easily convert a Promise to an Observable by doing var stream = Rx.Observable.fromPromise(promise), so let's use that. The only difference is that Observables are not Promises/A+ compliant, but conceptually there is no clash. A Promise is simply an Observable with one single emitted value. FRP streams go beyond promises by allowing many returned values.

Array is value++. In JS you can easily convert a value to an Array by doing var array = [value], so let's use that. The only difference is Arrays are not ECMAScript Basic Values compliant, but conceptually there is no clash. An Array is simply a value with one single entry. OOP arrays go beyond values by allowing many contained values.

spion commented Jul 1, 2014

This is pretty nice, and shows how FRP is at least as powerful as Promises. So if you believe the Promises hype, keep an eye on what FRP is capable of.

This is probably incorrect. Because promises deal with single events, they're also able to memoize and accept new subscribers after the event. AFAIK Observables are incapable of retaining values: to get the same functionality one would have to use both repeat(), and .take(1) before each attached consumer.

Promises abstract immutable, asynchronously available values. FRP abstracts values that change over time. They're different abstractions and as such useful in different circumstances.

jmandel commented Jul 2, 2014

Lovely Tutorial!

Quick correction: In the snippet below, which motivates fromPromise but isn't used directly in your final demo app, the use of .then is an error:

 var responseStream = Rx.Observable.create(function (observer) {
    jQuery.getJSON(requestUrl)
    .then(function(response) { observer.onNext(response); })
    .fail(function(jqXHR, status, error) { observer.onError(error); })
    .done(function() { observer.onCompleted(); });
  });

The issue is that .then() returns a new Promise, so the .fail and .done handlers are attached to the wrong object.

Hardwareman commented Oct 7, 2014

We use our formative years learning how best to navigate in a parallel-concurrent world. Programmers must learn—and keep on learning—how to navigate in the strictly linear-sequential world of computation and make the LS-ness of the machine essentially transparent to the user. A tough task and the effort too often fails.我们用我们的成长岁月来学习如何最好地在一个并行并发的世界中导航。程序员必须学习--并且不断学习--如何在严格的线性-顺序计算世界中导航，并使机器的LS性对用户基本透明。这是一项艰巨的任务，而且这种努力常常失败。

I would like to share some of my work on a fundamentally parallel-concurrent method of building process controllers. It has a special logic and operators that are much better for creating systems that react to real-world events.我想与大家分享一下我在构建过程控制器的基本并行-并发方法上的一些工作。它有一个特殊的逻辑和运算符，更适合于创建对现实世界事件做出反应的系统。

My solution is hardware, as my UN suggests. A key realization is that, lo and behold, we think in P-C mode all the time. We just don’t have the P-C machines w/w to build our reactive systems and must do it with the ubiquitous LS systems that are fundamentally unsuitable for those jobs.我的解决方案是硬件，正如我的联合国建议的那样。一个关键的认识是，看啊，我们一直在用P-C模式思考。我们只是没有P-C的机器来建立我们的反应式系统，而必须用无处不在的LS系统来做，这些系统从根本上说不适合这些工作。

Wouldn't it make more sense to provide a GitHub user stream by flattening each response array down? Something like this:将每个响应数组扁平化，提供一个GitHub用户流不是更有意义吗？像这样。

var userStream = Rx.Observable.range(0)
    .flatMap(function(i) {

        return Rx.Observerable.fromArray(response);
    });

(I've never looked at RxJS and this code is untested but hopefully conveys what I mean. I realise this user stream would be in order which isn't what we want as well.)(我从来没有看过RxJS，这段代码也没有测试过，但希望能表达我的意思。我意识到这个用户流将是按顺序排列的，这也不是我们想要的。）

Hey @bbirand, if I understand you correctly, I think you have something that you observe changes in values at an unknown cadence, and you want to map that to an observable sequence that published values at a known cadence. An example might be a GPS sensor that pushes events at various intervals (maybe as the device moves) and you want to only get information at most every second, and only if the value has actually changed. In this case Rx is great at dealing with this.嘿，@bbirand，如果我没有理解错的话，我想你有一个东西，你以未知的节奏来观察数值的变化，你想把它映射到一个可观察的序列，以已知的节奏来发布数值。一个例子可能是一个GPS传感器，它以不同的时间间隔推送事件（也许随着设备的移动），你想最多只在每秒钟得到信息，而且只有当值确实发生了变化。在这种情况下，Rx可以很好地处理这个问题。

gpsValues.bufferWithTime(1000)
    .where(function(gpsPoints){ return gpsPoints.length >0; })

mbernat commented Nov 28, 2014

FRP is programming with asynchronous data streams.FRP是用异步数据流编程。

No it's not. FRP is programming with Behaviours (pure continuous-time dependent values); please read the links you yourself provide, especially what Conal Elliott writes (since he's the one who coined the term).不，它不是。FRP是用Behaviours（纯粹的连续时间依赖值）编程；请阅读你自己提供的链接，特别是Conal Elliott写的东西（因为他是创造这个术语的人）。

If you only have discrete stuff, i.e. events, streams, or whatever you want to call it, you have stream-based/data-flow/reactive programming. Just because it's now fashionable to call everything that's not standard imperative programming FRP, doesn't mean we should do it. So please don't.如果你只有离散的东西，即事件、流，或者你想叫它什么，你就有基于流/数据流/反应式编程。仅仅因为现在流行把所有不是标准的命令式编程的东西都称为FRP，并不意味着我们应该这样做。所以请不要这样做。

One way to fix this is by moving the startWith() close to the refreshClickStream, to essentially "emulate" a refresh click on startup.解决这个问题的一个方法是把startWith()移到refreshClickStream附近，以便在启动时基本上 "模拟 "一次刷新点击。

You can "emulate" a refresh click on a startup using startWith(). The value that you pass to startWith() is irrelevant, because it is not used to make the request. davidgish760 commented Apr 12, 2016

Fantastic article, thanks!
Is there some advantage to treating a constant string as a stream, or were you just demonstrating that it can be done? Also, since events occur in time and are "pushed", the order in which streams and observers are created would seem to matter, at least from a conceptual standpoint. Take that constant string, for example. Presumably it "emits" its value at launch (or compile time)? When observers subscribe to it, does it re-emit the value? Isn't that essentially a "pull"?很好的文章，谢谢!
把一个恒定的字符串当作一个流有什么好处吗，还是说你只是在证明可以这样做？另外，由于事件发生在时间上，而且是 "推 "出来的，所以至少从概念上看，流和观察者的创建顺序似乎很重要。以那个恒定的字符串为例。据推测，它在启动时（或编译时）"发出 "它的值？当观察者订阅它时，它是否会重新发射这个值？这难道不是本质上的 "拉 "吗？

Copy link

davidgish760 commented Apr 13, 2016

Just realized @staltz hasn't commented for well over a year. For anyone who cares, the answer to my question above is that a constant string is an example of a "cold" sequence that pushes a private (to the new subscriber only), unique copy of its value, along with an end-of-stream, each time it is subscribed to.

Projects each element of an observable sequence into a new sequence of observable sequences by incorporating the element's index and then transforms an observable sequence of observable sequences into an observable sequence producing values > only from the most recent observable sequence.通过加入元素的索引，将一个可观察序列的每个元素投射到一个新的可观察序列中，然后将一个可观察序列的可观察序列转变为一个只从最近的可观察序列产生值>的可观察序列。

adrianmcli commented Jan 6, 2017

I've refactored the JSBin example to ES6 syntax and collected some of the logic into helper functions to make the program logic more clear:我把JSBin的例子重构为ES6语法，并把一些逻辑收集到辅助函数中，使程序逻辑更加清晰。

// Helper Functions --------------------------------------------
const makeRequestUrl = () => {
  const randomOffset = Math.floor(Math.random() * 500);
  return `https://api.github.com/users?since=${randomOffset}`;
};

const getRandomUser = users =>
  users[Math.floor(Math.random() * users.length)];

// Program Logic -----------------------------------------------
const requestStream = refreshClickStream
  .startWith('startup click')
  .map(makeRequestUrl);

const responseStream = requestStream
  .flatMap(url => Rx.Observable.fromPromise($.getJSON(url)));

const createSuggestionStream = closeClickStream =>
  closeClickStream
    .startWith('startupclick')
    .combineLatest(responseStream, (click, users) => getRandomUser(users))
    .merge(refreshClickStream.map(() => null))
    .startWith(null);

const suggestion1Stream = createSuggestionStream(close1ClickStream);
const suggestion2Stream = createSuggestionStream(close2ClickStream);
const suggestion3Stream = createSuggestionStream(close3ClickStream);

The full source (pastable into JSBin) is here: https://gist.github.com/adrianmcli/31732d17268c762132c7ca053f3d7cb2完整的源代码（可粘贴到JSBin中）在这里：https://gist.github.com/adrianmcli/31732d17268c762132c7ca053f3d7cb2
A refactor of André Staltz's example twitter program in his tutorial on RxJS: https://gist.github.com/staltz/868e7e9bc2a7b8c1f754
Raw
tutorial-refactor.js
// UI Event Streams --------------------------------------------
const refreshButton = document.querySelector('.refresh');
const closeButton1 = document.querySelector('.close1');
const closeButton2 = document.querySelector('.close2');
const closeButton3 = document.querySelector('.close3');
const refreshClickStream = Rx.Observable.fromEvent(refreshButton, 'click');
const close1ClickStream = Rx.Observable.fromEvent(closeButton1, 'click');
const close2ClickStream = Rx.Observable.fromEvent(closeButton2, 'click');
const close3ClickStream = Rx.Observable.fromEvent(closeButton3, 'click');
// Helper Functions --------------------------------------------
const makeRequestUrl = () => {
const randomOffset = Math.floor(Math.random() * 500);
return `https://api.github.com/users?since=${randomOffset}`;
};
const getRandomUser = users =>
users[Math.floor(Math.random() * users.length)];
// Program Logic -----------------------------------------------
const requestStream = refreshClickStream
.startWith('startup click')
.map(makeRequestUrl);
const responseStream = requestStream
.flatMap(url => Rx.Observable.fromPromise($.getJSON(url)));
const createSuggestionStream = closeClickStream =>
closeClickStream
.startWith('startupclick')
.combineLatest(responseStream, (click, users) => getRandomUser(users))
.merge(refreshClickStream.map(() => null))
.startWith(null);
const suggestion1Stream = createSuggestionStream(close1ClickStream);
const suggestion2Stream = createSuggestionStream(close2ClickStream);
const suggestion3Stream = createSuggestionStream(close3ClickStream);
// Rendering ---------------------------------------------------
function renderSuggestion(suggestedUser, selector) {
const suggestionEl = document.querySelector(selector);
if (suggestedUser === null) {
suggestionEl.style.visibility = 'hidden';
} else {
suggestionEl.style.visibility = 'visible';
const usernameEl = suggestionEl.querySelector('.username');
usernameEl.href = suggestedUser.html_url;
usernameEl.textContent = suggestedUser.login;
const imgEl = suggestionEl.querySelector('img');
imgEl.src = "";
imgEl.src = suggestedUser.avatar_url;
}
}
suggestion1Stream.subscribe(function (suggestedUser) {
renderSuggestion(suggestedUser, '.suggestion1');
});
suggestion2Stream.subscribe(function (suggestedUser) {
renderSuggestion(suggestedUser, '.suggestion2');
});
suggestion3Stream.subscribe(function (suggestedUser) {
renderSuggestion(suggestedUser, '.suggestion3');
});

acutmore commented Feb 4, 2017 •
edited

@marioscience Rx.Observable.fromEvent(refreshBtn, 'click') returns a shared observable (i.e only one eventListener will be added) but the observable returned from the other operators (.map etc) are not shared so will be repeated separately for each subscribe@marioscience Rx.Observable.fromEvent(refreshBtn, 'click')返回一个共享的观察值（即只添加一个eventListener），但从其他操作符（.map等）返回的观察值不是共享的，所以会在每个订阅中单独重复。
The simple fix is to put .share() after the startWith('https://api.github.com/users')简单的解决方法是将.share()放在startWith('https://api.github.com/users')之后。

BenReilly commented Jan 11, 2018

There are a number of people asking about the string value passed in var requestStream = refreshClickStream.startWith('startup click'). There's an answer above, but I think I'd like to try and restate it for beginners. It took me a few readings before my "oh yeah!" moment.有很多人问及在var requestStream = refreshClickStream.startWith('startup click')中传递的字符串值。上面有一个答案，但我想我想尝试为初学者重述一下。我读了几遍才发现 "哦耶！"的时刻。

var requestStream = refreshClickStream.startWith('startup click')
This line creates the observable stream. The first emitted value is the string 'startup click'. Every other emitted value will be the values in refreshClickStream, meaning they will all be events.这一行创建了可观察流。第一个发出的值是字符串'startup click'。其他每个发射的值都是 refreshClickStream 中的值，这意味着它们都是事件。

What type of values are emitted are irrelevant in this particular piece of code because the next line is:在这段特殊的代码中，发射什么类型的值并不重要，因为下一行是。

.map(function() {
That creates a new observable from the original. The function handling the mapping process doesn't have any parameters, which means it's not going to use the value from the original observable. It's pretty much just using the values emitted from the original observable to indicate a new value needs to be emitted from the new observable.这就从原来的观察变量中创建了一个新的观察变量。处理映射过程的函数没有任何参数，这意味着它不会使用原始观察者的值。它几乎只是使用从原始观测器发出的值来表示需要从新的观测器发出一个新的值。

Thus:因此。
var randomOffset = Math.floor(Math.random()*500);
return 'https://api.github.com/users?since=' + randomOffset;
});

It creates the url regardless of what value the original observable had. The original observable could be emitting numbers, arrays, objects, puppies, small furry creatures from Alpha Centauri, or anything. The mapping handler function is just gonna know it's time to go and create the url from the randomOffset.它创建了url，而不考虑原始观测器有什么值。原始的观察变量可以是数字、数组、物体、小狗、半人马座阿尔法星的小毛茸茸的生物，或者任何东西。映射处理函数只是知道现在是时候去创建来自 randomOffset 的 url 了。

So literally, 'startup click' could be substituted with 'foo' or 42 or {some: 'object'} or ['an','array','of','arbitrary','length']. You'd get the same result.所以从字面上看，'启动点击'可以用'foo'或42或{some: object'}或者['an', 'array', 'of', 'arbitrary', 'length']。你会得到同样的结果。

It's easier to conceptualize the data as waves rather than a stream. What you're observing is either frequency intervals or discrete packets. Hi there @staltz, 2020, and still the best introduction I know!嗨，@staltz，2020年，仍然是我知道的最好的介绍!

One thing I noticed is that you mention the Reactive Manifesto. I just wanted to clarify that the concept is not related to Reactive Programming. Reactive Systems are a set of properties to build loosely-coupled and scalable systems. It's more of an infrastructure/architecture broader topic that regards the system and not the programming technique. Since this is under the section "What is Reactive Programming?" it might diverge the thoughts of the readers.我注意到一件事，你提到了《反应式宣言》。我只是想澄清一下，这个概念与反应式编程没有关系。反应式系统是一套建立松散耦合和可扩展系统的属性。它更像是一个基础设施/架构的宽泛话题，涉及系统而不是编程技术。由于这是在 "什么是反应式编程？"一节中，它可能会使读者的想法发生分歧。

Thanks again for the impressive document!再次感谢您提供的令人印象深刻的文件!
